head.title: Unacceptable Alternative For Those Locked-Up Dogs

hedline.hl1: Unacceptable Alternative For Those Locked-Up Dogs

block.p: Robert Lipsyte states that it is a shame that we expect our elderly citizens to rely on pets for affection rather than on other humans. And he calls pets "living toys," which I find both inaccurate and offensive.

Robert Lipsyte states that it is a shame that we expect our elderly citizens to rely on pets for affection rather than on other humans. And he calls pets "living toys," which I find both inaccurate and offensive.

I happen to be an octogenarian who is blessed with children who, along with their spouses, are always there for me. My grandson and his wonderful bride virtually dote on me. But if you took my cat away, I would be bereft. He gives me a kind of affection and companionship that is totally unique, something that Mr. Lipsyte clearly has never known. I pity him.
